title: Sure, here's a reading list of 20 articles on automatic grammatical error correction (GEC
note: that spans historical approaches as well as focusing on neural approaches up to 2020:

title: HOO 2012: A report on the preposition and determiner error correction shared task
container-title: *Proceedings of the Seventh Workshop on Building Educational Applications Using NLP*

title: The CoNLL-2013 shared task on grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the Seventeenth Conference on Computational Natural Language Learning: Shared Task*

title: Building a state-of-the-art grammatical error correction system
container-title: *Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics*

title: The CoNLL-2014 shared task on grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the Eighteenth Conference on Computational Natural Language Learning: Shared Task*

title: Generating artificial errors for grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the Student Research Workshop at the 52nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics*

title: Grammatical error correction using neural machine translation
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2016 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*

title: A multilayer convolutional encoder-decoder neural network for grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the Thirty-Second AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence*

title: Approaching neural grammatical error correction as a low-resource machine translation task
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2018 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*

title: Neural quality estimation of grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2018 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing*

title: Fluency boost learning and inference for neural grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 56th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Improving grammatical error correction via pre-training a copy-augmented architecture with unlabeled data
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*

title: Neural grammatical error correction systems with unsupervised pre-training on synthetic data
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing and the 9th International Joint Conference on Natural Language Processing

title: Tense-specific sequence-to-sequence grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing and the 9th International Joint Conference on Natural Language Processing

title: Corpora generation for grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*

title: Improving grammatical error correction with data augmentation by editing sentences automatically
container-title: *Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics*

title: An empirical study of incorporating pseudo data into grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing and the 9th International Joint Conference on Natural Language Processing

title: A neural grammatical error correction system built on better pre-training and sequential transfer learning
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing and the 9th International Joint Conference on Natural Language Processing

title: MaskGEC: Improving neural grammatical error correction via dynamic masking
container-title: *Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics*

title: GECToR – Grammatical Error Correction: Tag, Not Rewrite
container-title: *Proceedings of the Fifteenth Workshop on Innovative Use of NLP for Building Educational Applications*

title: Encoder-decoder models can benefit from pre-trained masked language models in grammatical error correction
container-title: *Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics*

title: These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the evolution of grammatical error correction systems, from rule-based and statistical approaches to the latest advancements in neural network-based methods
